app.viewmanagers

Class SettingsViewManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • app.viewmanagers.SettingsViewManager

  • public class SettingsViewManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the view manager for the Settings component, which appears as a pop up when "settings" is entered as a command or if the settings button is clicked. It lets the user set the directory of the .json document, as well as options to enable/disable random list cell colors and notifications.

    • Method Detail

      • focusOnButton

        public void focusOnButton()
        UX feature. Set the default button as cancel to prevent accidental changing of settings.

      • cancelFocusOnButton

        public void cancelFocusOnButton()
        Remove the focus on the cancel button.

      • setAbsolutePathToDirectory

        public void setAbsolutePathToDirectory(java.lang.String absolutePath)
        This is called internally when opening the settings view. This file path refers to the location of watdo.json. * This fills the text field with the file path as set in settings.json.
        Parameters:
        absolutePath - The absolute path to the directory of watdo.json. e.g. /foo/bar/baz/

      • setNotificationsEnabled

        public void setNotificationsEnabled(java.lang.Boolean notificationsEnabled)
        Set the notifications checkbox depending on whether notifications are enabled.
        Parameters:
        notificationsEnabled - True if the user enables Notifications.

      • setRandomColorsEnabled

        public void setRandomColorsEnabled(java.lang.Boolean randomColorsEnabled)
        Set the random colors checkbox depending on whether random colors are enabled.
        Parameters:
        randomColorsEnabled - True if random colors if the user enables random colors in the TaskListView.

      • setRootViewManager

        public void setRootViewManager(RootViewManager rootViewManager)
        Set back-reference to rootViewManager.
        Parameters:
        rootViewManager - The instance of RootViewManager where this SettingsViewManager instance was created from.
